paragraph_text: A bank shall establish and maintain adequate policies, procedures and controls to detect and deter and report suspicious transactions.
Enhanced due diligence shall be performed on customers assessed as higher risk, including politically exposed persons (PEPs) and their close associates.
The bank shall monitor customer transactions on an ongoing basis for indicators of money laundering or terrorism financing.
Cash transactions of SGD 10,000 and above shall trigger a cash transaction report (CTR) within 5 business days.
The bank shall not establish or continue a correspondent banking relationship with a shell bank.
Material outsourcing arrangements must be approved by the Board or a Board committee.
The bank shall conduct due diligence on the third-party service provider before entering into an outsourcing agreement.
Critical systems outsourced to cloud providers must have exit strategies and data retrieval plans in place.
Banks shall implement transaction monitoring systems capable of detecting structuring and smurfing patterns in real time.
Alerts generated by the transaction monitoring system shall be investigated within 3 business days.
Operational risk management framework must include identification, assessment, monitoring and control/mitigation of operational risks.
Business continuity plans shall be tested at least annually and upon material changes.
Banks shall maintain a Liquidity Coverage Ratio (LCR) of at least 100% at all times.
The Net Stable Funding Ratio (NSFR) shall not fall below 100% on an ongoing basis.
The bank shall appoint a Money Laundering Reporting Officer (MLRO) who reports directly to senior management.
Concentration risk arising from outsourcing to a single provider shall be assessed and mitigated.
Multi-factor authentication is mandatory for all internet banking and corporate banking customers.
Banks shall conduct penetration testing at least annually and after any material system change.
Transaction monitoring rules shall be reviewed and updated at least annually or upon emergence of new typologies.
The Board is ultimately responsible for the bank’s risk data aggregation capabilities and risk reporting practices.
Suspicious Transaction Reports (STRs) shall be filed with the Suspicious Transaction Reporting Office (STRO) no later than 15 calendar days after detection.
The bank shall maintain records of all customer due diligence information for at least 5 years after the business relationship has ended.
Audit trails must be maintained for all outsourced processes to enable effective oversight.
Name screening against sanctions lists shall be performed in real-time for all transactions.
Virtual asset service providers (VASPs) are considered high-risk customers requiring enhanced due diligence.
Banks shall disclose key regulatory ratios and risk exposures in a consistent and comparable format.
Correspondent banking relationships with banks in high-risk jurisdictions require senior management approval.
API security testing must be conducted before go-live and annually thereafter.
Third-party risk assessments shall be performed annually and upon material changes to the service.
The bank shall ensure that the outsourcing provider allows it to remain in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.
Training on AML/CFT shall be provided to all relevant staff at least annually.
High-quality liquid assets (HQLA) must be unencumbered and readily available.
Structuring detection rules must cover both cash deposits and electronic transfers below reporting thresholds.
The transaction monitoring system shall generate alerts for rapid movement of funds through accounts.
The bank shall conduct independent audits of its AML/CFT program at least every two years.
Data sovereignty requirements must be addressed in cloud outsourcing contracts.
Risk reports provided to the Board shall be accurate, timely and comprehensive.
Incident response plans shall be tested at least annually with tabletop and technical exercises.
Stablecoin-related activities are subject to the same AML/CFT requirements as traditional fiat.
The bank shall not open anonymous accounts or accounts in fictitious names.
Funnel account detection must include velocity and turnover analysis.
Operational resilience framework shall include scenario testing for cyber attacks and third-party failure.
Available stable funding shall be calculated using prescribed regulatory factors.
Termination clauses in outsourcing contracts must allow orderly exit within 90 days.
The bank shall implement a risk-based approach to customer due diligence.
